nodes.text: My name’s Maida Buckner; I take care of trading and drinks here. What will it be for you, friend?
What may I help you with?
My mother takes care of the rooms. You should talk to her about that.
Have you seen my brother Torr anywhere? He lost some more brahmin and ma yelled at him. He must  have run off after that.
Well now, anything else that I can do for you?
Thanks for finding my brother, Torr. Ma and I were so worried.  What can I do for you?

The only way I know to create a Garden of Eden is through plain old hard work. That's something you tribals just don’t seem to understand. But I guess that’s the difference between us civilized folk  and yourselves.
I’d be so grateful if you could find my brother for mom and me.
Hello there, my good friend.
The Den is a bad place to go. They even enslave ignorant tribals like yourself. It’s a week or so south of here, but most folks that’ve gone there don’t come back.
Looks as though you don’t have enough money for that.
I don’t know where he went for certain, but I think that he might have run off to that canyon he was always talking about.
I’d like to buy a round of drinks for everyone here by way of introducing myself. I’m from Arroyo.
Well, okay then. If you really want to pay for the damage he caused...I guess all of you tribals  really stick together.
Well, he may be slow, but he does sort of grow on you after a while. (looks away wistfully)... (flustered) Now that’s enough jaw flapping; do you need anything else?

Well, you see, Sulik got real upset one night and had too much booze. Then, when he was good and drunk, he busted up the place. He did nearly $500 worth of damage. Just now getting the place  repaired.
Questions, huh? Well get on with it, then. Talking to you doesn’t get my work any closer to being finished.

Well there’s a canyon just east of where we graze the brahmin. Torr used to come up with wild stories about bugmen coming from there. He said that it was bugmen what mutilated our brahmin. Scared himself silly with those fool stories.
There are only a couple of other towns nearby. There’s Redding far to the southwest, and the Den a few days south. But I wouldn’t go to the Den.
Well, I didn’t count tribes when you asked about civilized towns. But I guess there’s a group of savages somewhere to the northwest -- and then Sulik’s tribe, far to the southwest.
Sulik’s a tribal that’s working here to pay off a debt he foolishly incurred. He is not a slave. We don’t have slaves here in Klamath.
He said he found out that his sister had been kidnapped by slavers. But you’d have to ask him more about that. He’s here until he can pay off the rest of the damage he did while he was drunk.
I think he might have taken off to the canyon to prove his bravery or something. I sure hope someone can find him before he hurts himself.

My name’s Maida Buckner; I take care of trading and drinks here. I don’t tolerate any tribals messing our family’s place up. So you just better watch your step here, or you’ll end up like Sulik. What do you want?
I’ll sure be glad to have that damn (sob) tribal (sob) away (sob, sob) from  here. (sob)
He still has to pay off $350. If he weren’t so lazy and shiftless it would go quicker for him. He’s not leaving here until his debt is paid in full.
Thanks so much. I take back all those things I said about tribals. Please find my brother for  me.
You want to barter? I’m always looking for good quality gecko pelts, and I pay a fair price for them, too.
You’ve really made me angry. I don’t want anything further to do with you. Now just get out. Tribals, humph! (mutter, mutter) ...shiftless, worthless, lazy...
Well, you’d be better off asking momma about what’s going on right here in town.
Hmm - seems as though your elevator doesn’t rise all the way to the top floor. Why don’t you talk to my brother, Torr? He’s a little closer to your speed. Goodbye.
You’re back, huh? I hope you’re taking care of Sulik. I’m sure he’s lost without me telling  him what to do.
A round for everyone. My, my - aren’t you a generous one? That’ll be $30.
Have you found my brother yet? I sure hope he’s alright.
I don’t know why anyone would want to pay off his debt, but they could. His bill comes to $350. But you wouldn’t want to do that -- he’d only get into trouble again.

links.text: I was looking for someplace to stay.
I guess I don’t need anything right now. Goodbye.
I was looking for someplace to stay.
I guess I don’t need anything right now. Goodbye.
Ok, thanks. There’s something else that I wanted to know, though.
I’ll talk to her about that then. Goodbye.
Ok, thanks. There’s something else that I wanted to know, though.
Ok, thanks. There’s something else that I wanted to know, though.
Ok, thanks. There’s something else that I wanted to know, though.
Uh-oh, where do you think he might have gone?
I’m sorry to hear that, but I need information about something else.
That’s all I need for now. Goodbye.
You’re a tough bargainer, but fair. Tell me about something else.
I was hoping for better prices. You sure aren’t cheap. Tell me about something else.
Actually, there was something else that I wanted to trade for.
Happy to find Torr, but I don’t think I need anything right now. Goodbye.
Gee, I guess I have a lot to learn from you folks. I’d like to be civilized, too, someday.
Civilized? You think you’re civilized because you live in the burnt-out ruins of a beforetime town? Tell me something else.
I think I’ve heard just about enough. Goodbye.
Uh, I guess. Tell me about something else then.
I’m sorry, but I don’t think I really have time for that right now. Goodbye.
I’d be happy to look for him.
I was looking for someplace to stay.
I guess I don’t need anything right now. Goodbye.
Tell me about the local tribes.
Interesting. Let me ask you something else, though.
Isn’t Sulik your slave? Or do you just treat him like one?
Uh, well, I guess I’ll settle for some information then.
Uh, well, I guess I’ll settle for some information then.
Uh, well, I guess I’ll settle for some information then.
Oh, maybe I’ll come back when I have more. Goodbye.
Uh, well, I guess I’ll settle for some information then.
A canyon? What canyon?
I’d love a nice beer. Fill ‘er up.
Maybe that is too much money. I don’t think I want to pay for his damages after all. Goodbye.
Yes, I do. I have enough to pay for the damages that he caused.
That’s all I need for now. Goodbye.
I was curious about something else.
What if someone else paid Sulik’s damages?
Why’d he get so upset?
What other towns are nearby?
Tell me about Sulik.
Have you ever heard of something called a Garden of Eden Creation Kit?
I think that’s all I need to know for now. Goodbye
Sounds as though it would scare just about anybody.
Thanks for the advice. Tell me something else though.
Why wouldn’t you go to the Den?
That’s all I need to know about for now. Goodbye.
What about tribes in the area?
What about the Den?
Interesting. Let me ask you something else, though.
That’s funny, my tribe doesn’t count pre-war towns when we talk about civilized places. Tell me  something else.
Tell me about Sulik.
Paying off a debt? What do you mean?
How much does he have to work off?
I’m really sorry you can’t find him. I’m sure he’s fine. I need some information.
Maybe I should try to find him.
Who knows where your idiot brother went to -- and who cares? I need some information.
I was looking for someplace to stay.
I guess I don’t need anything right now. Goodbye.
Well, somehow, I think Sulik might actually miss being here. But we’ll be back to visit sometime, I’m sure. Right now, though, I need something.
Thanks; I guess maybe I should be going now.
I think Sulik’s going to be a lot better off away from you.
That’s a lot of money. I think he’s going to be here for a long time.
I will; you can count on me.
I guess I don’t need to trade right now. Goodbye.
Yes, I’d like to trade with you.
I’m very sorry that I upset you. I’m just ignorant of your ways here. I was trying to show you respect in the manner of my tribe.
I just didn’t know what to say to someone as attractive as yourself. I always get nervous when I’m near a beautiful woman. Please accept my apologies.
Gosh, I’m really, really sorry. I’m just an ignorant tribal, after all. Can you possibly forgive  me?
I don’t want to have anything to do with you either. Goodbye.
I’m back because I need something.
I’m back because I need something.
I’m back because I need something.
Well, I’m sure I can’t do as good a job of taking care of him as you did, but I’ll sure try.
I’m back because I need something.
I think maybe I’ll just settle for some information for now.
I guess I’d rather just have a drink for myself after all.
Have one on me, folks. Now, how about some information as well?
I think maybe I’ll just settle for some information for now.
I think maybe I’ll just settle for some information for now.
I think maybe I’ll just settle for some information for now.
[MORE]
[MORE]
[MORE]
[MORE]
Well, I’m sure he must be happy working for you folks, but I still want to pay his damages. I don’t think anyone should be trapped the way he is.
I guess you’re right. I don’t have that much money to spare, anyway. Goodbye.
I don’t like him having to stay here with a bigot like you. I want to pay for his damages.
